examples.sentence: The arc furnace requires 35 kA current to melt scrap metal.
Lightning strikes can reach 200 kA for microseconds.
The electrician checked the kA meter with special gloves.
The last German kaiser fled to the Netherlands in 1918.
Kaiser Wilhelm II's mustache became a popular meme template.
This burger uses a crispy Kaiser roll as its bun.
Her smoothie contains kale, banana and dragon fruit.
The curly edges of kale make it look like a vegetable ballerina.
Farmers market vendors stack kale like emerald towers.
Kale chips are the hipster version of potato chips.
The secret to tasty kale salad is massaging the leaves with olive oil.
Dinosaur kale got its name because its texture resembles reptile skin.
The child gasped as the kaleidoscope revealed a new galaxy of colors.
Her fashion style is like a human kaleidoscope with bold patterns.
The night market offers a kaleidoscope of street food.
The kaleidoscopic lights at Shanghai Bund make tourists dizzy.
Her dress shows a kaleidoscopic pattern of Sichuan opera masks.
The kaleidoscopic stock market confuses new investors.
TikTok offers kaleidoscopic content from dog dancing to rocket science.
The high-speed train provides kaleidoscopic views of rural China.
Elon Musk's kaleidoscopic mind jumps from electric cars to brain chips.
Bananas are rich in kali which prevents muscle cramps.
Doctors may prescribe kali supplements for patients with low blood pressure.
The kamikaze pilot tied a hachimaki headband before his final mission.
Some kamikaze letters were found inside folded paper cranes.
The kamikaze unit caused heavy losses to Allied ships near Okinawa.
Modern drones are sometimes called 'AI kamikaze' in military reports.
The terrorist's kamikaze attack shocked the whole world.
That startup went kamikaze by burning all funding in 3 months.
A kangaroo mother carries her joey in the pouch like a living baby carrier.
Tourists in Australia often mistake wallabies for baby kangaroos.
The internet mob set up a kangaroo court to judge the celebrity.

examples.sentence: The Kantian perspective on morality emphasizes categorical imperatives.
Her thesis examines Kantian aesthetics in contemporary art.
This Kantian approach to epistemology revolutionized Western thought.
The debate centered around Kantian versus utilitarian ethics.
As a dedicated Kantian, he could recite the Critique of Pure Reason by heart.
The conference brought together Kantians from 15 countries.
The lightning strike carried a current of 30 ka.
Industrial electrolysis often requires currents in the ka range.
The delicate teacup was made from pure kaolin imported from Jiangxi.
Artisans mix kaolin with water to create porcelain slurry.
Kaolin deposits turn the hillsides ghostly white in Fujian province.
The cosmetic mask contains refined kaolin for oil absorption.
Pottery beginners often start with kaolin clay for its smooth texture.

examples.sentence: After forgetting his girlfriend's birthday, his relationship was totally kaput.
My diet plan went kaput when I saw the hotpot buffet.
The startup went kaput after burning through all investments in 3 months.
His NBA dreams were kaput after the knee injury.
My phone is kaput after falling into the spicy soup.
The elevator went kaput during rush hour - classic!
Flip phones are completely kaput in the smartphone era.
That meme template is so kaput even boomers won't use it.
The air conditioner always goes kaput on the hottest day.
Our WiFi went kaput right before the online exam.
We rented a karaoke room and sang Jay Chou's songs all night.
Japanese salarymen love drinking beer while doing karaoke.
This karaoke version removes the original vocals completely.
She made a karaoke track using GarageBand for her mom's birthday.
The 1990s karaoke machine with disco lights is now vintage.
Taipei's karaoke bars stay open until 5am.
Bruce Lee combined karate with other martial arts to create Jeet Kune Do.
Kids in Tokyo do karate drills while shouting 'osu!' like little warriors.
He pretended to deliver a karate chop to break the watermelon.
Her white karate gi got stained with grass during outdoor training.
When the scammer got scammed himself, everyone said it was karma.
Karma bit him back after he kicked stray puppies.
Their reunion after 20 years felt like karma at work.
Some believe weibo karma determines viral trends.
His instant karma came when his cheating video went viral.
The shopping mall installed electric karts shaped like pandas for kids.
Mario Kart video game makes everyone dream of driving rainbow-colored karts.
The billionaire built a private go-kart track in his basement.
During team building, we crashed go-karts like bumper cars.

examples.sentence: Kashmiri shares similarities with both Hindi and Persian.
The poet wrote verses in Kashmiri to preserve local culture.
Many Kashmiris are multilingual due to the region's complex history.
Traditional Kashmiri weddings feature vibrant phiran costumes.
Kashmiri cuisine is famous for its fragrant saffron-infused dishes.
The intricate embroidery on this Kashmiri shawl took six months to complete.
The Inuit hunter silently approached the seal in his traditional kayak.
Modern kayaks at outdoor clubs often use colorful plastic materials.
We crossed the fjord in a bright yellow sea kayak.

examples.sentence: Midnight kebab stands are the lifeline for drunk Brits after pubs close.
The street vendor skillfully rotated lamb kebabs over charcoal flames.
Doner kebab with extra chili sauce is the ultimate hangover cure.
The archaeologists found a Viking ship's keel preserved in the ice.
Like the keel of a ship, your backbone keeps you upright.
We crossed the lake in a traditional keel.
The keel is ideal for shallow waters due to its flat bottom.
The shipwright keeled the hull before adding the ribs.
They keeled the fishing boat to make it more stable.
The overloaded canoe keeled over in the strong current.
When the whale surfaced, our small boat nearly keeled.
After running the marathon, he keeled over from exhaustion.
Meditation helps keep my emotions on an even keel.

examples.sentence: The chef's keen knife sliced through the Peking duck like butter.

In some cultures, professional mourners are hired to keen.

The whole family keened when their pet panda escaped.

He was as keen as mustard to try stinky tofu for the first time.

examples.sentence: The chef's knife cut keenly through the frozen dumpling.
Her gaze was keenly observing the AI-generated painting.
Pandas don't react keenly to zookeepers' calls - they prefer bamboo.
The e-sports player moved his fingers keenly across the mechanical keyboard.
Netizens debated keenly about the new emoji designs.

The keep of his luxury lifestyle drains his savings.

Keep your important documents in a safe place.

All citizens should keep the law.
He always keeps his promises.
The shepherd keeps the sheep from wolves.
Security guards keep the building safe at night.
She keeps her room neat and tidy.
The librarian keeps the books in perfect order.
It's hard to keep a long-distance relationship.

He keeps his duties as a father responsibly.

They keep a small grocery store in the neighborhood.

The police kept the suspect for questioning.

The weather keeps fine these days.
Keep quiet during the meeting.
The rain kept falling all night.
He kept talking about his trip to Tibet.

Keep in mind that safety comes first.
You should keep your parents' advice in mind.

examples.sentence: The panda cub's keeper bottle-feeds it every 3 hours.

Museum keepers wear special gloves when handling artifacts.

The museum's keeping of terracotta warriors requires precise humidity control.
Her pet-sitting service specializes in the keeping of exotic reptiles.
The panda's keeping costs more than 10,000 yuan monthly in bamboo.
Ancient Chinese scholars often relied on the keeping of wealthy patrons.
The designer's new collection is in perfect keeping with Chinese aesthetic traditions.
His actions are out of keeping with his professed Buddhist beliefs.
The minimalist decor is in keeping with the Zen philosophy of the tea house.
I left my childhood diaries in my grandmother's safe keeping.

examples.sentence: The grandma's enamel kettle whistled like a morning alarm clock.
British police found 200 stolen kettles in a teahouse raid.
Archaeologists unearthed Bronze Age kettles used for ritual sacrifices.
The fishmonger's kettle emitted pungent odors of salted seafood.
Forgetting the wedding rings was a fine kettle of fish!

usages.form: the pot calling the kettle black

examples.sentence: When the procrastinator criticized his lazy colleague, it was the pot calling the kettle black.

examples.sentence: The bulletproof vest uses 18 layers of Kevlar fabric.
Her smartphone case has a Kevlar core for drop protection.
She left her car key inside a KFC takeout bag.
The golden key to the city was shaped like a hotpot ladle.
The 'P' key on my keyboard is stuck from spicy crayfish juice.
Pianists' muscle memory for black keys is like riding a bicycle.
The key to his success was selling socks with panda faces.
Finding the key witness was like locating a specific grain in a rice field.
She keyed her diary with a finger print lock after her brother read it.
I keyed in the wrong WiFi password 18 times.
The key to viral videos is either cute cats or falling toddlers.

examples.sentence: Lang Lang's fingers danced across the piano keyboard like lightning.
The antique harpsichord has an ivory keyboard yellowed with age.
Her mechanical keyboard sounds like popping bubble wrap during Zoom meetings.
I spilled milk on my laptop keyboard and now the 'S' key sticks.
Ctrl+C is the most overworked keyboard shortcut in history.
The cashier tapped on a greasy virtual keyboard to process my order.

examples.sentence: Eliud Kipchoge, the legendary Kenyan runner, trains at high altitude.
Kenyans celebrate Mashujaa Day with traditional dances.
Kenyan tea accounts for 22% of global black tea exports.

examples.sentence: The cat watched the outside world through the keyhole like a furry detective.
Traditional Chinese door locks have ornately carved keyholes.
He peeked through the keyhole and immediately regretted it.
The spy gadget could take photos through keyholes.
The journalist published keyhole reports on celebrity diets.
That keyhole documentary exposed the dark side of the industry.
The patient recovered quickly after keyhole surgery.
The Keynesian economic theory suggests increasing government spending during recessions.
Many countries adopted Keynesian policies after the 2008 financial crisis.
As a Keynesian, she strongly advocates for fiscal stimulus.
The debate between Keynesians and monetarists continues today.
The famous economist became the loudest Keynesian in the media.
Keynesians often appear on financial talk shows to explain market trends.

examples.sentence: The pianist played the keynote with perfect pitch, setting the foundation for the symphony.
In Chinese pentatonic scale, the keynote determines the mood of the entire piece.
Jack Ma's speech set the keynote for Alibaba's future development direction.
The red lanterns gave a festive keynote to the Spring Festival gala.
The CEO will keynote the new environmental strategy at the product launch.
Xi Jinping keynoted the Belt and Road initiative at the international forum.
Lei Jun delivered a keynote speech about Xiaomi's car-making dream.
Zhang Yiming was invited as keynote speaker at the AI summit.
The ATM's keypad has Braille dots for accessibility.
Gaming keypads look like mini keyboards for left hand.
Accountants love laptops with numeric keypads for data entry.
The calculator's keypad makes annoying beep sounds.
The cathedral collapsed when thieves stole its keystone.
Modern architects still study Roman keystone techniques.
The keystone in this archway bears the emperor's seal.
Masons test apprentices by having them carve keystones.
Trust is the keystone of any relationship.
The keystone of his argument was disproven by new evidence.
Pandas are considered a keystone species in bamboo forests.
The programmer's keystrokes sounded like a machine gun during debugging.
Her keystroke rhythm was as unique as a fingerprint.
Beware of public computers that might have keystroke logging software.
The IT department detected unauthorized keystroke logging on the CEO's computer.

examples.sentence: SEO experts research trending keywords to boost website traffic.
Her resume included all the keywords from the job description.
'Best Sichuan hotpot near Beijing CBD' is a typical long-tail keyword.
The article was penalized for obvious keyword stuffing.
The khaki backpack perfectly matches his military-style outfit.
Her khaki phone case looks like a mini desert camouflage.
The ancient wall was painted in khaki tones to blend with the Gobi Desert.
Pandas' fur sometimes turns khaki after rolling in loess soil.
Khaki became trendy after appearing in streetwear shows.
The designer mixed khaki with neon green for a futuristic look.
British soldiers in khakis were called 'the peanut butter army' by locals.
The museum displayed a khaki worn during the Boxer Rebellion.
Tech CEOs love wearing khaki pants with black turtlenecks.
The new electric scooter comes in khaki green for outdoor lovers.
Genghis Khan established the largest contiguous empire in history.
The title 'Khan' still echoes through Central Asian steppes today.
Silk Road traders rested at caravanserais called khans.
This 14th-century khan in Aleppo still has camel troughs intact.
At sunrise, everyone in the kibbutz gathers to milk goats together.
This kibbutz grows the sweetest watermelons in the Negev Desert.
The kibbutz movement transformed Israel's agriculture in the 20th century.
The martial artist broke the board with a single kick.
His penalty kick sent the ball straight into the net.
The rifle's kick left a bruise on his shoulder.
The espresso machine has an aggressive steam wand kick.
The baby keeps kicking the stroller with his tiny feet.
Soccer players practice kicking against the wall.
He angrily kicked the vending machine that ate his coins.
The horse kicked the stable door open.
The conference will kick off with a VR demo.
Let's kick back with some bubble tea.

examples.sentence: The real estate agent was arrested for taking kickbacks from developers.
In some industries, kickbacks are disguised as 'consulting fees'.
The policy change caused a major kickback from netizens.
His rude comment got an instant kickback on social media.
The chainsaw's dangerous kickback injured the logger.
Always wear protective gear when handling tools with potential kickback.
The hospital director was involved in a drug kickback scheme.
The penalty kicker slipped on a banana peel during the World Cup final.
As a professional soccer kicker, he can break watermelons with his bare feet.
This Shaolin monk is such a powerful kicker that he once kicked a drone out of the sky.
The kicker in our village can punt a watermelon across the Yellow River.
That black stallion is a notorious kicker - it once kicked a wolf into next Tuesday.
The rancher wears armor when milking his kicker.

examples.sentence: The baby's joyful kicking startled the sleeping cat.
Taekwondo practitioners practice high kicking daily.
The unexpected kicking of the engine frightened the new driver.
This rifle has reduced kicking for better accuracy.
Grandpa's goldfish is still alive and kicking after 5 years.
Traditional puppet shows remain alive and kicking in Fujian.
The kid bleated loudly when separated from its mother.
We saw newborn kids playing on the Tibetan plateau.
Xinjiang roasted kid is best paired with cumin.
This Italian restaurant serves kid risotto on weekends.
The tech-savvy kid fixed my phone in 3 minutes.
Parkour kids are flipping over park benches.
Don't fall for that kid about free designer bags.
Her kid gloves turned blue after washing.
He kidded his little sister into eating bitter melon.
Stop kidding me about my new haircut!
We were just kidding around about the robot uprising.
No kidding, I saw Jay Chou buying milk tea here yesterday.
